required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Muscle Specific and Movement Specific Muscle Energy Technique in the Management of Mechanical Neck Pain: a Randomized Controlled Trial.
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Muscle Specific and Movement Specific Muscle Energy Technique in the Management of Mechanical Neck Pain: a Randomized Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: the purpose of this study is to compare the effects of muscle-specific muscle energy technique and movement-specific muscle energy technique in terms of pain, function and cervical range of motion in persons with mechanical neck pain.

primary_outcome.description: Pain will be measured using Visual Analogue Scale, with greater score signifying greater pain
Function and neck related disability will be measured using Neck Disability Index, with greater score signifying greater disability and poorer outcome
Cervical Range of Motion will be measured using a universal goniometer, with greater score signifying more favorable outcome

intervention.intervention_name: Muscle Specific Post Isometric Relaxation MET
intervention.description: 3-5 reps of Post Isometric Relaxation MET targeted at muscles of the neck prone to get short

intervention.intervention_name: Movement Specific Post Isometric Relaxation MET
intervention.description: 3-5 reps of Post Isometric Relaxation MET targeted at specific movements of the cervical spine
3 sets of unilateral posteroanterior glide (10-15 oscillations) at the involved segment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Mechanical neck pain ranging from 40-80 mm on visual analogue scale (VAS) Age between 19-44 years Pain or limitation on cervical motion
-
Exclusion Criteria:
History of fracture, surgery or trauma in the neck Cervical radiculopathy Myelopathy Spondylosis Syringomyelia Thoracic outlet syndrome Infection Malignancy Inflammatory or rheumatic disorders Vascular syndromes

facility.name: Foundation University Institute of Rehabilitation Sciences.
